value.title: Relationship in Power BI with Multiple Columns
value.excerpt: You can create relationships in Power BI between tables. Relationships are useful for some functions to work across multiple tables and produce the result. Relationship between tables also makes visualization and report elements more efficient, because the result of selection in one chart can affect

value.title: Computing rolling average in DAX
value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Create and share your first Power BI report
value.excerpt: With Power BI, you can create compelling visuals and reports. In this module, you learn how to use Power BI Desktop to connect to data, build visuals, and create a report that you can share with others in your organization. You then learn how to publish the report to the Power BI service, so that others can see your insights and benefit from your work.

value.title: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 data​
value.excerpt: Connect and analyze your Dynamics 365 Data​

value.title: Create dashboards in Power BI
value.excerpt: Microsoft Power BI dashboards are different than Power BI reports. Dashboards allow report consumers to create a single artifact of directed data that is personalized just for them.  Dashboards can be comprised of pinned visuals that are taken from different reports. Where a Power BI report uses data from a single dataset, a Power BI dashboard can contain visuals from different datasets.

value.title: Perform analytics in Power BI
value.excerpt: You will learn how to use Power BI to perform data analytical functions, how to identify outliers in your data, how to group data together, and how to bin data for analysis. You will also learn how to perform time series analysis. Finally, you will work with advanced analytic features of Power BI, such as Quick Insights, AI Insights, and the Analyze feature.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Work with Power BI visuals
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose from the exceptional visuals that Power BI makes available to you. Formatting visuals will direct the user’s attention to exactly where you want it, while helping to make the visual easier to read and interpret. You will also learn about how to use key performance indicators (KPIs).

value.title: Append and Merge Tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly merge and append tables using the query editior in Power BI. Build models with multiple data sources. Contact me on LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.excerpt: We can utilize Python and Scikit-Learn machine algorithms in Power with the Run Script option. value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE

The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx
